es.uam.eps.ir.relison.links.recommendation.reranking.global.swap.comm.gini.edge.CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement<U>
Type Parameters:
U - type of the users
All Implemented Interfaces:
GlobalReranker<U,​U>
Direct Known Subclasses:
OuterCompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement
public class CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement<U>
extends AbstractCommunityEdgeGiniComplement<U>
Swap reranker that optimizes the Gini index of the distribution of edges between communities. Both edges between different communities and links inside of communities are considered.
Author:
Javier Sanz-Cruzado (javier.sanz-cruzado@uam.es), Pablo Castells (pablo.castells@uam.es)

  • Constructor Details

    • CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement

      protected CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement​(double lambda, int cutoff, java.util.function.Supplier<Normalizer<U>> norm, Graph<U> graph, Communities<U> communities, boolean selfloops, boolean outer)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      lambda - establishes the trade-off between the value of the Gini Index and the original score
      cutoff - the maximum number of contacts in the definitive rankings.
      norm - the normalization scheme.
      graph - the original graph.
      communities - the relation between communities and users in the graph.
      selfloops - true if selfloops are allowed, false if they are not.
      outer - true if we want to force links to go outside communities.

    • CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement

      public CompleteCommunityEdgeGiniComplement​(double lambda, int cutoff, java.util.function.Supplier<Normalizer<U>> norm, Graph<U> graph, Communities<U> communities, boolean selfloops)
      Constructor. By default, this algorithm does not force links to go outside communities.
      Parameters:
      lambda - establishes the trade-off between the value of the Gini Index and the original score
      cutoff - the maximum number of contacts in the definitive rankings.
      norm - the normalization scheme.
      graph - the original graph.
      communities - the relation between communities and users in the graph.
      selfloops - true if selfloops are allowed, false if they are not.
